SRP.A: The peak of  Humanities is to the {right} of the peak of Vocational Training.

EVJ.A: The ridgeline representing {Physical Education} has the highest peak.

EVJ.A: At X =39.3,the label with the highest density is {Physical Education}

NF.Q: Which countries in the ridgeline chart have ridgeline peaks exceed 55? Please list the countries and corresponding peak values.
NF.A: {Humanities}'s peak at {57},{Language Courses}'s peak at {78},{Arts}'s peak at {81}

NF.Q: Which countries in the ridgeline chart have ridgeline peaks below 72? Please list the countries and corresponding peak values.
NF.A: {Physical Education}'s peak at {30},{Humanities}'s peak at {57},{STEM Subjects}'s peak at {8},{Vocational Training}'s peak at {37}

NC.Q: Which one has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline: Physical Education or Vocational Training?
NC.A: {Vocational Training} has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline.

NC.Q: Which one has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline: Vocational Training or STEM Subjects?
NC.A: {Vocational Training} has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline.

NC.Q: Which one has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline: Language Courses or Humanities?
NC.A: {Language Courses} has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline.

MSR.Q: How many ridges have their peak located to the right of the average X value across all ridges?
MSR.A: There are {3} ridges whose peaks are located to the right of the average X value.

MSR.Q: What is the label of the ridge with the largest span along the mountain height?
MSR.A: The ridge with the largest span in the mountain height is {Physical Education}
